business.headline: Explained: Why did Protean shares crash 20% todayProtean eGov Technologies, earlier known as NSDL e-Governance Infrastructure, provides technology solutions for various citizen-focused services.

India ousts Turkey's Celebi: $200 million lost in market-cap, jobs on the lineThe company, listed on the Istanbul Stock Exchange, saw its shares drop 20% in just two trading sessions. On 16 May, the stock fell 222 points to close at 2,002 lira.
Sensex opens 50 points lower, Nifty above 25,000; IT stocks down in early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 36.40 points to 82,366.99, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 5.65 points to 25,014.15 as of 9:26 am.
Sensex, Nifty today: Key levels and sectors to watch. Here's how to tradeMarket experts say there is still positive momentum in the market, but traders should be cautious and focus on key levels.

Stock market opening today: Sensex, Nifty to open flat. Here's whyThe Nifty50 index gained 4.2%, and foreign investors bought shares worth Rs 15,925 l . Thast week. This was the fifth week in a row of buying by foreign portfolio investors.

Stocks to watch on May 19: Bajaj Auto, Delhivery, Dr Reddy's, JSW Steel, BELMany companies will be in focus due to their earnings and key updates, such as Power Grid Corporation of India, Bharat Electronics, DLF, ACME Solar Holdings, Bajaj Auto, Delhivery, Dr Reddy's, JSW Steel, etc.

Bengal to be impacted by Bangladesh import curbs, but nation first: OfficialsThe central government on Saturday imposed port restrictions on the import of a few Bangladeshi goods, such as readymade garments and processed food items.

India restricts Bangladesh imports through northeast check postsA wide range of Bangladeshi products will be restricted via the Integrated Check Posts in the northeastern states of Assam, Meghalaya, Tripura, and Mizoram.

India-US Bilateral Trade Agreement: Final Phase Negotiations Aim For ConclusionUnion Minister Piyush Goyal will lead a team to the United States for trade talks. India and the US are working to finalize the Bilateral Trade Agreement (BTA) by early July. The US President has proposed a trade agreement with India that would have no tariffs on a wide range of American products. The US President stated, 'India is one of the highest tariff nations in the world. It's very hard to sell into India.'

Adani drops Chinese lounge partner DragonPass: What it means for Indian flyersThe move, triggered by rising national security concerns, has ended DragonPass's access to Adani-managed airport lounges across the country.

Why the middle class is chasing expensive brands, explains market expertA market expert noted that nearly 75% of luxury spending today comes from the middle class, not due to rising incomes, but because of social media, marketing tricks, and peer pressure that fuel the urge to appear successful.

Indian traders' body boycotts Turkey and Azerbaijan over support for PakistanThe move comes after both Turkey and Azerbaijan openly showed support for Pakistan, at a time when India is facing sensitive national security challenges.

entertainment.headline: Will get befitting reply: Ravi Kishan's warning to Pak against 'terrorist activity'Actor and BJP MP Ravi Kishan talked about India's Operation Sindoor against Pakistan-backed terrorism, and highlighted that we will give a 'befitting reply' to our neighbour if they 'provoke' us.

Rasha Thadani recreates mother Raveena's iconic Tip Tip Barsa Paani at event. WatchActor Rasha Thadani stole attention after she recreated her mother Raveena Tandon's iconic hit 'Tip Tip Barsa' from 'Mohra' at an award show. The video of her performance has gone viral.

New beginnings: Singer Keneeshaa's cryptic post amid actor Ravi Mohan's divorceSinger Keneeshaa shared a poetry about 'noise' and 'new beginnings' on her Instagram page. This post comes days after actor Ravi Mohan called her companion in four-page note against his ex-wife Aarti amid divorce battle.

Kyunki... fame Achint Kaur asks for work, says actor's life has peaks and pausesAchint Kaur, known for playing Mandira in 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi', posted a video asking for suitable work opportunities as an actor and voice-artiste. She also mentioned that her profession has its highs and lows.

Urvashi Rautela is bewitching in black at Cannes, but fans spot wardrobe glitchActor Urvashi Rautela's black outfit at Cannes drew attention after a viral video highlighted a small tear in her dress. Despite the mishap, she earned praise for her fashion choice.

Rashmika Mandanna asks fans to wait amid 'The Girlfriend' delay: Delivering soonActor Rashmika Mandanna and director Rahul Ravindran appealed to their fans to be patient amid 'The Girlfriend's' delay.  The actor promised that the updates would follow soon.

Mission Impossible 8 box office Day 2: Solid opening weekend, beats OppenheimerTom Cruise's 'Mission: Impossible-The Final Reckoning' is working fabulously at the box office in India. The film finished its first-weekend run on a strong note, also surpassing the two-day business of 'Oppenheimer'.

Suniel Shetty, Athiya praise KL Rahul after he smashes 5th century in IPLAthiya and her father-actor Suniel Shetty, praised KL Rahul after he smashed a century for at least three different franchises. This came after the Delhi Capitals game against the Gujarat Titans (GT) on May 18.

Resist ageism: Nicole Kidman's advice at Cannes as she champions gender equalityActor Nicole Kidman is 2025's recipient of Women in Motion Award at the Cannes Film Festival. Speaking at the event, she advocated for 'resisting ageism' in the world of cinema.

Nothing, just Ananya Panday recreating Main Tera Tota… with father ChunkyAnanya Panday and her father Chunky Pandey recreated the iconic song 'Main Tera Tota Tu Meri Maina' at a Saturday award function. Videos shared on Ananya's fan pages quickly won hearts online.

Tom Cruise shares glowing praise for rumoured girlfriend Ana de Armas' BallerinaHollywood star Tom Cruise was all praises for rumoured girlfriend Ana de Armas's film 'Ballerina'. He spoke about it during the London premiere of his film 'Mission: Impossible - The Final Reckoning'.

Paresh Rawal confirms Hera Pheri 3 exit, says 'had no creative difference'Bollywood actor Paresh Rawal has announced his exit from the eagerly-awaited film Hera Pheri 3, clarifying that it is not due to creative differences. He expressed his respect and faith in the director Priyadarshan.

Sonu Kakkar reunites with Neha-Tony for parents' anniversary after family riftAfter publicly acknowledging a rift with her family, singer Sonu Kakkar was seen celebrating her parents' anniversary. The pictures also featured her siblings, Neha and Tony Kakkar.

Mission Impossible 8 box office Day 1: Tom Cruise film opens strong at Rs 17.5 cr'Mission: Impossible – The Final Reckoning' has made a grand entry in India, releasing six days ahead of the global launch and receiving an enthusiastic response from Indian audiences. The film has become the highest-opening Hollywood film of 2025.

Gram Chikitsalaya: Amol Parashar's show is a healing touch, diagnosing deeper truth'Gram Chikitsalaya' is about a doctor trying to make a village more aware of the healthcare system that they need, but it is also about a deep understanding of the neglected rural population of the country. The series is headlined by Amol Parashar as Dr Prabhat Sinha.

Malti's adorable tea party with Priyanka Chopra's manager is the cutest thingPriyanka Chopra's daughter, Malti, hosted an adorable tea party for her mother's manager. Sweet moments from their intimate celebration were shared online on Sunday.

Guns N Roses: Ecstatic fans say 'even gods wanted this to happen' after Mumbai showGuns N' Roses rocked Mumbai on Saturday with an electrifying performance. Elated fans shared highlights from the unforgettable night on their respective X handles.

Singer Rahul Vaidya thanks Virat Kohli for unblocking him: You are pride of IndiaAfter previously calling Virat Kohli and his fans "jokers," singer Rahul Vaidya has now thanked the cricketer for unblocking him on Instagram. Sharing a screenshot of his post, Vaidya praised Kohli, calling him the pride of India.

Aishwarya-Abhishek groove to Kajra Re at wedding, daughter Aaradhya joinsVideos of Aishwarya Rai and Abhishek Bachchan from a recent wedding are now going viral. The clips were shared by singer Rahul Vaidya, who performed at the event.

general news.headline: Pakistan targeted Amritsar on May 8, how India's air defence saved Golden TemplePakistan engaged in an air assault with aerial weapons, including drones and long-range missiles, targeting the Golden Temple, which was "thwarted" by the army personnel, who remained prepared for such situations and attacks.

Op Sindoor Ground Report: How Army's fierce response foiled Pak barrage in JammuIndia Today spoke to the Indian Army bravehearts stationed along the International Border in Jammu, who swiftly and resolutely countered Pakistan's attacks, inflicting heavy casualties and destroying enemy posts.

UP man arrested on charges of spying for Pak, was in constant touch with ISIArrested from Moradabad in Uttar Pradesh, Shehzad had repeatedly visited Pakistan, smuggled goods across the border, and allegedly passed classified Indian security information to ISI agents.

Trinamool's Yusuf Pathan snubs government's Op Sindoor delegation inviteTrinamool Congress MP Yusuf Pathan has declined to join the Operation Sindoor foreign outreach delegation, after the government named him allegedly without consulting his party.
India Today at LoC: Unexploded Pak ammo recovered, destroyed on cameraThe Indian Army recovered and exploded Pakistani ammunition on camera. Gaurav Sawant from India Today was as the position.

Police foil bomb plot in Hyderabad, 2 ISIS-linked suspects arrestedPolice foiled an ISIS-linked bomb plot in Hyderabad, arresting two suspects, Siraj and Sameer, in a joint Telangana-Andhra operation.
Will resign if..: Himanta Sarma doubles down on Pak charge against Gaurav GogoiSarma claimed that Gogoi went to Pakistan at the invitation of Pakistan's spy agency Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI).

Heavy overnight rain floods parts of Bengaluru, traffic takes a hitBengaluru residents woke up to another wet Monday with roads waterlogged as rains lashed the city overnight. Several low-lying areas were flooded and many parts of the city saw waterlogging. With gridlocks across many parts of Karnataka's capital city.

Decoding heart attack: The silent pandemic raging worldwideIn the post-Covid world, changing lifestyles, increased stress conditions, and poor environment are putting the heart under extreme pressure. We look at how the heart is at risk, and the world is eying a raging "silent pandemic."
An Architectural Trail in GujaratPress Release | Vadnagar has substantial remains of its ancient Buddhist heritage.

Joe Biden, 82, diagnosed with aggressive form of prostate cancerFormer US President Joe Biden has been diagnosed with an aggressive form of prostate cancer that has spread to his bones. His team says the cancer is hormone-sensitive and treatment options are being explored with doctors and family.

Hyderabad blaze: Eyewitness recalls lifeless woman clutching dead childrenZahid, who runs a bangles business in nearby Gulzar House, quickly rushed to the spot with his friends to come to the family's aid. Instead, what they found upon breaking into the fire-engulfed house was a string of dead bodies -- the lifeless body of a woman clinging to the charred bodies of children.

Why India grounding Turkish aviation firm Celebi is a seismic security shiftThe government has been recalibrating economic engagement, with national security as the new axis. Pakistan's ally Turkey is the latest to be hit

News Menu, May 19: Parliament panel briefing on Op Sindoor, India-US trade dealIndia Today's Monday news menu dishes out a sharp blend of Operation Sindoor updates, politics over diplomatic delegations, espionage scandals, crucial trade negotiations, and the latest in the Sambhal dispute, all prepared for your day.

After Operation Sindoor, India to give intel on Pak camps to anti-terror watchdogFollowing the success of Operation Sindoor and the subsequent exposure of Pakistan's denial of harbouring terrorists, India plans to submit fresh intelligence to the global terrorist financing watchdog, the Financial Action Task Force (FATF), regarding terrorist infrastructure operating within Pakistan.

Mission Impossible 8 box office Day 2: Solid opening weekend, beats OppenheimerTom Cruise's 'Mission: Impossible-The Final Reckoning' is working fabulously at the box office in India. The film finished its first-weekend run on a strong note, also surpassing the two-day business of 'Oppenheimer'.

Arrested YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra was being developed as Pak asset: CopsA day after YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra 's arrest over allegedly spying for Pakistan, the police explained how Pakistan's intelligence operatives were using Indian social media influencers to 'push their narrative'.

Who was Saifullah Khalid, LeT's elusive shadow commander killed in PakRazaullah Nizamani Khalid, also known as Abu Saifullah Khalid, was a key Lashkar-e-Taiba operative and mastermind behind the 2006 RSS headquarters attack, the 2008 CRPF Rampur camp strike, and the 2005 IISc Bengaluru attack.

Congress on professor's arrest over Op Sindoor post: His mistake is his nameThe arrest of Ashoka University's head of the Political Science Department, Ali Khan Mahmudabad, over his Operation Sindoor post exposes the Narendra Modi government's 'double standards,' the Congress said. 'His only mistake is that he wrote this post. His other mistake is his name,' party leader Pawan Khera tweeted.

As another Gujarat family dies at US border, why 'America at all costs' still luresDespite warnings and crackdowns, the cycle of hope and heartbreak continues, with far too many having paid the ultimate price

Joe is a fighter: Kamala Harris, Trump voice support after Biden's cancer revealFormer US President Joe Biden has been diagnosed with aggressive prostate cancer. Leaders from across the political spectrum, including Donald Trump, Kamala Harris, and Hillary Clinton, have shared messages of support, wishing him a full and speedy recovery.

Question of respect: Chief Justice flags 'protocol lapse' during Maharashtra visitChief Justice BR Gavai, during his first visit to Maharashtra, said that senior state officials —including the Chief Secretary, DGP, and Mumbai Police Commissioner — were absent to receive him.
Bhopal man approaches woman after her breakup, killed by her ex-loverA woman's ex-boyfriend stabbed another man to death when he came to know that he was approaching her after their breakup.

sports.headline: Shubman Gill a true leader, he's happy to let Sai Sudharsan shine: Sunil GavaskarIPL 2025, DC vs GT: Batting great Sunil Gavaskar lauded the hugely-successful partnership between Shubman Gill and Sai Sudharsan. The duo added 205 runs for the opening partnership as Gujarat hammered Delhi by 10 wickets on Sunday to secure their spot in the playoffs.

Max Verstappen admits his Imola win surprised him: Didn't think I'd winFormula 1: Max Verstappen turned a weekend of doubt into triumph at Imola, securing Red Bull's milestone 400th race victory and tightening the title race with a win he hadn't expected to even compete for.

Sinner jokes brother chose Formula 1 over watching his final vs AlcarazDespite losing the Italian Open final, Jannik Sinner kept spirits high with a cheeky remark about his brother missing the match for Formula 1, while Carlos Alcaraz claimed his first Rome title and continued his clay dominance.

Rahul Dravid defends Dhruv Jurel after yet another close defeat in IPL 2025Rajasthan Royals' head coach Rahul Dravid came to the defence of young players like Dhruv Jurel after another failed run chase dented their IPL 2025 campaign. Dravid blamed both finishing issues and bowling lapses, while urging patience with the team's young Indian core.

How Gill and Sudharsan built one of IPL's most prolific partnershipsShubman Gill and Sai Sudharsan have formed one of IPL's most prolific opening partnerships. Their trust and low-risk style have propelled Gujarat to the IPL playoffs and set new partnership records.

One spot, three teams: Battle for IPL playoffs explainedPL 2025: Three teams - Gujarat, Punjab and Bengaluru - confirmed their spots in the playoffs on Sunday. With just one place up for grabs, three teams - Mumbai, Lucknow and Delhi - remain in the race

Captain Shubman Gill delighted to evolve as Gujarat Titans storm into playoffsShubman Gill said that he's delighted to evolve from his learning curve as captain, as Gujarat Titans qualified for the playoffs of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025), following a comprehensive 10-wicket win over Delhi Capitals (DC).

Carlos Alcaraz spoils Sinner's Rome party, asserts Roland Garros favourite statusItalian Open 2025: Carlos Alcaraz reaffirmed his status as the favourite to defend his French Open crown by hammering World No. 1 Jannik Sinner in straight sets in the final in Rome on Sunday. The defeat ended Sinner's unbeaten run in the 2025 season.

Shreyas Iyer becomes 1st captain to lead 3 different teams to IPL playoffsPunjab Kings have qualified for the IPL 2025 playoffs for the first time since 2014. Shreyas Iyer became the first captain to lead three different franchises into the IPL playoffs, marking a unique achievement.

Sai Sudharsan 108 trumps KL Rahul's 112 as GT storm into playoffsGujarat Titans secured a spot in the IPL 2025 playoffs after a commanding 10-wicket win against Delhi Capitals. Their strategic batting and top performances from Sudharsan and Shubman Gill highlighted the team's strong title ambitions this season.

DC vs GT: Kuldeep Yadav risks sanction after snapping at umpire over LBW callIPL 2025, DC vs GT: Kuldeep Yadav lost his cool after his LBW appeal against Sai Sudharsan was overturned. Gujarat Titans dominated the Capitals in a high-stakes match on Sunday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
